whyStonesShellGold.question: Neden Ã¶zel taÅŸlar, deniz kabuklarÄ± ve altÄ±n para birimi olarak kullanÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±r?
whyStonesShellGold.text:
Well, these items all had some -- but not all -- of the characteristics of good money. 

So what characteristics make for â€œgoodâ€ money? 
Scarce: not abundant, nor easy to reproduce or copy 
Accepted: relatively easy for people to verify its authenticity 
Durable: easy to maintain, and does not perish or fall apart
Uniform: readily interchangeable with another item of the same form
Portable: easy to transport
Divisible: can be split and shared in smaller pieces
whyStonesShellGold.title: GeÃ§miÅŸ zamanda neden Ã¶zel taÅŸlar, deniz kabuklarÄ± ve altÄ±n para birimi olarak kullanÄ±lmÄ±ÅŸtÄ±r?

moneyImportantGovernement.question: Amerikan Dolar'Ä±nÄ± arzu ettiÄŸi zamanda kim Ã¼retebilir?
moneyImportantGovernement.text:
Modern-day economies are organized by nation-states: USA, Japan, Switzerland, Brazil, Norway, China, etc. 

Accordingly, in most every nation, the government holds the power to issue and control money. 

In the United States, the Central Bank (known as the Federal Reserve, or â€œFedâ€) can print, or create, more US Dollars at any time it wants. 

The â€œFedâ€ does not need permission from the President, nor Congress, and certainly not from US citizens.  

Imagine if you had the ability to print US Dollars anytime you wanted to -- what would you do??
moneyImportantGovernement.title: Para aynÄ± zamanda hÃ¼kÃ¼metler iÃ§in de Ã¶nemlidir.

answers: It is created by order of the National government in a given country.
feedback: DoÄŸru. Bir Ã¼lkenin merkez bankasÄ± o Ã¼lkenin itibari parasÄ±nÄ± basar.

WhatIsFiat.question: Amerikan DolarÄ± veya Ä°sviÃ§re FrankÄ± gibi itibari fiat paralarÄ± kim Ã¼retir?
WhatIsFiat.text:
All national currencies in circulation today are called â€œfiatâ€ money. This includes US Dollars, Japanese Yen, Swiss Francs, and so forth. 

The word â€œfiatâ€ is latin for â€œby decreeâ€ -- which means â€œby official orderâ€. 

This means that all fiat money -- including the US Dollar -- is simply created by the order of the national government.
WhatIsFiat.title: Ä°tibari fiat para birimleri: SonrasÄ± ne?

answers: BÃ¼tÃ¼n itibari paralar eninde sonunda hÃ¼kÃ¼met yetkilileri tarafÄ±ndan suistimal edilecektir.

HayÄ±r, bu kesinlikle doÄŸru deÄŸil.
YanlÄ±ÅŸ, tekrardan deneyiniz.
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.question: Neden itibari paralarÄ±n hÃ¼kÃ¼metler tarafÄ±ndan kontrol ediliyor olmasÄ±nÄ± Ã¶nemsemeliyim?
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.text:
As shared in a prior quiz, the US Central Bank is the Federal Reserve, or the â€œFedâ€.

The Fed can print more dollars at any time -- and does not need permission from the President, nor Congress, and certainly not from US citizens.  

Having control of money can be very tempting for authorities to abuse -- and often time leads to massive inflation, arbitrary confiscation and corruption. 

In fact, Alan Greenspan, the famous former chairman of The Fed, famously said the US â€œcan pay any debt that it has, because we can always print more to do thatâ€.
whyCareAboutFiatMoney.title:
HÃ¼kÃ¼metime gÃ¼veniyorum.
Ä°tibari paralar neden umurumda olmalÄ±?

YanlÄ±ÅŸ. HÃ¼kÃ¼metlerin banknotlarÄ±n gÃ¶rÃ¼nÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼nÃ¼ deÄŸiÅŸitirmesi para arzÄ±nÄ± arttÄ±rÄ±yorlar anlamÄ±na gelmez.
GovernementCanPrintMoney.question: HÃ¼kÃ¼metin para basmasÄ± nedir?
GovernementCanPrintMoney.text:
Well, everybody should care! 

The practice of government printing money -- or increasing the supply of dollars -- leads to inflation.

Inflation is an increase in the price of goods and services. In other words, the price for something in the future will be more expensive than today.

So what does inflation mean for citizens? 

In the United Kingdom, the Pound Sterling has lost 99.5% of its value since being introduced over 300 years ago. 

In the United States, the dollar has lost 97% of its value since the end of WWI, about 100 years ago. 

This means a steak that cost $0.30 in 1920... was $3 in 1990â€¦ and about $15 today, in the year 2020!
GovernementCanPrintMoney.title: HÃ¼kÃ¼metlerin para basabiliyor olmasÄ± kimin umurunda olmalÄ±?

answers: Åimdiye kadar kullanÄ±lan bÃ¼tÃ¼n itibari paralar ciddi anlamda deÄŸerini kaybetmiÅŸtir.
BanknotlarÄ± gÃ¶rÃ¼nÃ¼mÃ¼ ve tasarÄ±mÄ± yaklaÅŸÄ±k olarak her 10 yÄ±lda bir deÄŸiÅŸir.
feedback: DoÄŸru. Bu deÄŸerini kaybetmediÄŸini dÃ¼ÅŸÃ¼ndÃ¼ÄŸÃ¼mÃ¼z Amerikan DolarÄ± iÃ§in bile geÃ§erli, son 100 yÄ±lda Dolar alÄ±m gÃ¼cÃ¼nÃ¼n %97'sini kaybetti.
YanlÄ±ÅŸ, tekrar deneyiniz.
Tam deÄŸil. BanknotlarÄ±n tasarÄ±mÄ± deÄŸiÅŸse de deÄŸeri ile bir ilgisi yok.
FiatLosesValueOverTime.question: Ä°tibari para birimlerinin deÄŸeri zaman iÃ§inde ne olur?
FiatLosesValueOverTime.text:
That is correct. 

In the history of the world, there have been 775 fiat currencies created. Most no longer exist, and the average life for any fiat money is only 27 years.

The British Pound is the oldest fiat currency. It has lost more than 99% of its value since 1694. 

There is no precedent for any fiat money maintaining its value over time. This is inflation. 
It is effectively a form of theft of your own hard earned money !
FiatLosesValueOverTime.title: Bu itibari para birimlerinin zaman iÃ§inde deÄŸerini kaybettiÄŸi anlamÄ±na mÄ± geliyor?

answers: Money is difficult to move around the world, and can also be surveilled.
feedback: DoÄŸru. Ä°lerleyen sÄ±nav bÃ¶lÃ¼mlerinde bu konularÄ± aydÄ±nlatacaÄŸÄ±z.
YanlÄ±ÅŸ cevap. Bunun doÄŸru olmadÄ±ÄŸÄ±nÄ± sen de biliyorsun.
BazÄ±larÄ± bunun doÄŸruluÄŸuna inansa da bizim aradÄ±ÄŸÄ±mÄ±z cevap bu deÄŸil.
OtherIssues.question: Ä°tibari para birimlerinin halihazÄ±rda sahip olduÄŸu sornlardan bazÄ±larÄ± nelerdir?
OtherIssues.text:
Yes, there are many other issues that exist with modern fiat money. 

First, it can be extremely difficult to move money around the world. Often, governments will outright restrict the movement -- and sometimes even confiscate money -- without a valid reason or explanation. And even when you can send money, high transaction fees make it very expensive.

Second, even in the US, there has been a complete loss of privacy, as the majority of commerce takes places with debit and credit cards, as well as online with other systems such as PayPal and Apple Pay.

Ever notice how an ad appears in your social media or Gmail just moments after searching for a certain product or service? This is known as â€œsurveillance capitalismâ€, and is based on companies selling your personal financial data.
OtherIssues.title: OK, fiat money loses value over time. Are there other issues?

answers: Evet. HiÃ§ bir zaman 21 milyondan fazla Bitcoin oluÅŸturulamayacak.
No. The government can create more bitcoin at any time.
No, the bitcoin software can be changed to allow more bitcoins to be created.
feedback: Correct. By limiting the amount that can be created, Bitcoin is designed to increase in value over time.
Wrong answer. The government has no control over Bitcoin.
Incorrect. One of the key attributes of bitcoin is that the supply is limited forever.
LimitedSupply.question: Is the supply of bitcoin limited forever?
LimitedSupply.text:
Governments can print fiat money in unlimited quantities. 

By way of contrast, the supply of Bitcoin is fixed â€” and can never exceed 21 million coins. 

A continually increasing supply of fiat money creates inflation. This means that the money you hold today is less valuable in the future. 

One simple example: 
A loaf of bread that cost about 8 cents in 1920. In the year 1990 one loaf cost about $1.00, and today the price is closer to $2.50 ! 

The limited supply of bitcoin has the opposite effect, one of deflation. 

This means that the bitcoin you hold today is designed to be more valuable in the future â€” because it is scarce.
LimitedSupply.title:
Karakteristik Ã¶zellik #1:
SÄ±nÄ±rlÄ± arz

answers: Yes. It is centrally controlled by the United Nations.
Yes. It is centrally controlled by the worldâ€™s largest banks.
feedback: That is correct. There is no company, government or institution that controls bitcoin. Anyone can use bitcoin â€” all need is a smartphone and an internet connection.
YanlÄ±ÅŸ cevap. LÃ¼tfen tekrar deneyiniz.
Incorrect. You already know this is not true!
Decentralized.question: Bitcoin merkezi midir?
Decentralized.text:
Fiat money is controlled by banks and governments â€” which is why people refer to it as a â€œcentralizedâ€ currency.

Bitcoin is not controlled by any person, government or company â€” which makes it â€œdecentralizedâ€ 

Not having banks involved means that nobody can deny you access to bitcoin â€” because of race, gender, income, credit history, geographical location â€” or any other factor. 

Anybody â€” anywhere in the world â€” can access and use Bitcoin anytime you want. All you need is a computer or smartphone, and an internet connection!
Decentralized.title: Karakteristik Ã¶zellik #2: Merkeziyetsizlik

answers: Yes. Although creating fake bitcoin requires very specialized computers.
Yes. The government can print as much bitcoin as it likes.
feedback: That is the right answer. In a subsequent quiz, Honey Badger will explain details as to why this is so!
Incorrect. There is no way for anyone to copy or duplicate the value of a bitcoin.
Wrong. Although the government can print unlimited dollars, it can not print bitcoin.
NoCounterfeitMoney.question: Ä°nsanlar sahte Bitcoin Ã¼retebilir mi?
NoCounterfeitMoney.text:
Paper money, checks and credit card transactions can all be counterfeit, or faked. 

The unique software that runs the Bitcoin network eliminates the possibility of duplicating money for counterfeit purposes.  

New bitcoin can only be issued if there is agreement amongst the participants in the network. People who are voluntarily running bitcoin software on their own computers and smartphones.

This ensures that it is impossible to counterfeit, or create fake bitcoins.
NoCounterfeitMoney.title:
Karakteristik Ã¶zellik #3:
Sahtesi yapÄ±lamayan para

answers: One whole bitcoin. It is not possible to use anything less.
feedback: Yes. You can divide a bitcoin into 100,000,000 pieces. As you already know, the smallest unit of bitcoin â€” B0.00000001 â€” is known as a â€œsatâ€.
Wrong. Bitcoin is highly divisible. You can easily use a very small fraction of a bitcoin.
Incorrect. Although the smallest unit of US currency is one penny, a bitcoin is divisible by much more than 100x.
HighlyDivisible.question: What is the smallest amount of Bitcoin one can own, or use?
HighlyDivisible.text:
Old-fashioned fiat money can only be spent in amounts as small as one penny â€” or two decimal places for one US Dollar ($0.01).

On the other hand, Bitcoin can be divided 100,000,000 times over. This means that you could spend as little as â‚¿0.00000001. You will note the "â‚¿" symbol, which is the Bitcoin equivalent of "$". Sometimes you will also see the use of BTC, instead of â‚¿.

By way of contrast, Bitcoin can handle very small payments â€” even those less than one US penny!

No. It is open source software, and is easily attacked.
feedback: Correct. In fact, the Bitcoin network has never once been hacked. Answer the next question to learn more!
Nice try, but wrong. The bitcoin network is safe and secure â€” 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.
Icorrect. Although bitcoin is indeed â€œopen sourceâ€ software â€” or available to the public for free â€” is still extremely secure.
securePartOne.question: Bitcoin aÄŸÄ± gÃ¼venli midir?
securePartOne.text:
The bitcoin network is worth well over $100 billion today. Accordingly, the network must be very secure â€” so that money is never stolen. 

Bitcoin is known as the worldâ€™s first cryptocurrency. 

The â€œcryptoâ€ part of the name comes from cryptography. Simply put, cryptography protects information through very complex math functions. 

Most people do not realize â€” but Bitcoin is actually the most secure computer network in the world ! 

(you may have heard about bitcoin â€œhacksâ€ â€” which we will debunk in the next quiz)
securePartOne.title: Karakteristik Ã¶zellik #5: GÃ¼venlik -- 1. KÄ±sÄ±m

answers: Yes. Bitcoin usually gets hacked on holidays, when traditional banks are closed.
feedback: That is correct. The bitcoin network has never been compromised. However, it is important to use only secure digital wallets to keep your personal bitcoins safe at all times.
YanlÄ±ÅŸ, tekrardan deneyiniz.
No silly, you know that is not the correct answer.
securePartTwo.question: Bitcoin hiÃ§ hacklendi mi?
securePartTwo.text:
To be direct: the bitcoin network itself has never been hacked. Never once.

Then what exactly has been hacked? 

Certain digital wallets that did not have proper security in place. 

Just like a physical wallet holds fiat currency (in the form of paper bills), digital wallets hold some amount of bitcoin. 

In the physical world, criminals rob banks â€” and walk away with US Dollars. The fact that someone robbed a bank does not have any relationship as to whether the US Dollar is stable or reliable money. 

Similarly, some computer hackers have stolen bitcoin from insecure digital wallets â€” the online equivalent of a bank robbery. 

However, it is important to know that the bitcoin network has never been hacked or compromised !
securePartTwo.title: Karakteristik Ã¶zellik #5: 2. KÄ±sÄ±m

DefaultWalletScreen.title: Default Account
DefaultWalletScreen.info:
Pick which account to set as default for receiving and sending. You can adjust the send and receive account for individual payments in the mobile app. Payments received through the cash register or your Lightning address will always go to the default account.

To avoid Bitcoin's volatility, choose Stablesats. This allows you to maintain a stable amount of money while still being able to send and receive payments.

You can change this setting at any time, and it won't affect your current balance.

ThemeScreen.title: Theme
ThemeScreen.info: Pick your preferred theme for using Blink, or choose to keep it synced with your system settings.
